node.doctext:
OVERALL

  • Logo needs to be inserted into [e3 container] header.
  • Tabs need to be properly styled, including a "selected" class.
  • Login form / logout link needs to be styled in [e3 minilogin].
  • Search form needs to be rewritten to be simpler.
  • Search results need to combine full text, node titles, debates, categories, etc. into one relevance-based result set.
  • We need an intuitive way for a person to enter "Category" mode, whereby they can add a writeup/node to a category.
  • We need a nodelet that will appear briefly alongside other nodelets when a new notification appears.
  • When a user receives a message, we need some sort of visual cue in the header.
  • Everything needs to be tested for guest users, borged users, different level users, admin/non-admins, etc.
  • Master Control needs to be rewritten to be more efficient (mostly just cut out everything except the Node Notes and the Node Toolset.)

HOME

  • [Welcome to Everything] needs to be subverted to a simpler frontpage for the [e3 theme].
  • The [Cool Staff Picks] nodelet needs to be modeled after the [tfcool nodelet - zen].
  • Cool Staff Picks needs to be set to auto-update.
  • >We need a new nodelet to replace [News for Noders].
  • The new NFN nodelet needs to auto-update.
  • There needs to be a notification for changes to the NFN nodelet.
  • The writeup in Cream of the Cool needs to be set to fade-in/fade-out, instead of just update.
  • We need an "About Us" section.

READ

  • The Further Reading nodelet needs all 6 htmlcodes of "further reading" suggestions built: one for Random Nodes, one for Categories, one for softlinked nodes, one for other writeups by the user, one for recommended nodes based on [Do You C! What I C?], and one for new writeups.
  • The writeup header needs to be rewritten. It should be static, and contain: author, date submitted, reputation, C! list, a blab box, and links to bookmark and print the writeup.
  • The writeup footer also needs to be simplified. Just vote buttons and a link to C! for now.
  • We need an AdminTools htmlcode that contains links/forms to: forward a node, firmlink a node, lock a node, axe/instakill a node, insure a node, ed-cool a node, clone a node, view XML, edit node, viewcode a node, document a node, delete a node.
  • We need to integrate the [ShareThis] widget into our writeup header.

WRITE

Because the read/write portion of our site has been intertwined for so long, this is the tab that probably needs the most work, as well as the most "thoughtful design."

  • If someone clicks a link underneath an existing e2node/writeup to "Add your writeup to this node", it takes them here, to a pre-titled scratch pad.
  • The Helpful Hints nodelet ... needs to be helpful.
  • We should notify certain admins if a user with 0 writeups is on the write tab.
  • We need to build a custom nodelet that is essentially a "mini-chatterbox." This can be invoked by an admin on any user's page.
  • We should check if a writeup has been "asamothed" and notify admins.

CHAT

  • The Chatterbox needs to be restyled as an AIM-style chat, with more obvious spacing and delineation of each user's message.
  • We should implement [Gravatars] on the site.
  • We need to rebuild the Other Users nodelet to be more useful and dynamic.
  • We need to build a separate nodelet for [Message Inbox] that sits alongside the chatterbox nodelet.

PROFILE

  • Need to integrate Achievements into the site.
  • We need the ability to add a user to our favorites.
  • Ability to message user.
  • Display a user's last 3 writeups.
  • Allow in-line editing of a user's doctext and image.
  • Notifications are needed for when a person updates their doctext or image.

Profile Feed

  • Feed items need to be styled.
  • Users need the ability to delete items from their feed.
  • Should users be able to comment on other people's feed items a la Facebook?
  • Notification is needed for when a user adds a feed item.
  • We need filters up top for user bookmarks and user cools.
  • We probably need some pagination of some sort.
  • We may need to revise [displayUserFeed] into a nodelet.
  • We probably need to limit displayUserFeed based on time.

User Info

  • We need certain "profile" registries to show up here. These need to be editable in-line.
  • We might want to implement, for example, a Twitter API if a user provides an accountname that displays their last 10 items.
